action.primary: Cools the Blood and stops bleeding

indications: Blood Heat with epistaxis, hematemesis, hematuria, hemafecia or uterine bleeding

action.primary: Disperses Blood Stasis, reduces swelling and generates flesh

indications: Topically for carbuncles, sores, and swellings (Chuang Yung) (use fresh)

action.primary: Benefits the Gallbladder and reduces jaundice

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Spleen and Stomach Deficiency Cold.
Contraindicated for those with watery diarrhea or white dysenteric disorder.
Contraindicated for those with early stages of Hot dysenteric disorder.
Contraindicated for those with Stomach weakness leading to extreme Blood Deficiency.
Use with caution for those who do not have signs and symptoms of Blood Stagnation.
interactions: This herb has been shown to reduce the anticoagulant effect of warfarin. Use with caution to prevent the formation of clots.

useCases: Hematemesis and epistaxis due to Blood Heat.
Internal abscess such as Intestinal abscess.
Daily, as a drink for hypertension.
Hematemesis and hemoptysis. (use the charred forms of all of the herbs)
Mix and apply topically for sores and carbuncles.

notes: This herb can be used alone, in its fresh form, to treat hematemesis, epistaxis and profuse menstrual bleeding.
This herb is especially good for hematemesis and hemoptysis.
It can be used alone for Lung abscesses.
It can be used alone for hypertension.
This herb is stronger than Hb. Cirsii Xiao Ji.
The aerial part of the plant Da Ji Ye, drains abscesses.

Both Da Ji and Hb. Cirsii #{XiaoJi} Xiao Ji drive downward and guide out Stasis. Xiao Ji is not as strong as Da Ji and has very little sore-reducing effect. it can stop bleeding and reduce Heat. Its ability to break up Stasis to facilitate water movement is superior to that of Da Ji and is primarily used to promote urination. Da Ji treats swollen abscesses, breaks up Stasis and disperses toxicity.
Fresh Large Thistle Root Xian Da Ji Gen is better for cooling the Blood, stopping bleeding and reducing sores. It can be applied externally for sores, scalding and burns. It lowers Blood pressure.
Charred Large thistle Root Da Ji Tan is less cooling and aims directly into the Blood where it astringes and inhibits bleeding.
